channel.title: Offensive Reworks
channel.description:
[Main Thread](https://forum.imperium42.com/t/master-rework-of-doom/47102)
Offensive Reworks:
> [color=purple]**Servant (Unseen Offensive)**[/color] > > Passive: Dutiful > > Day Ability: Hallucinogenic Wine: The target will think they were poisoned. They will receive a notification if they were healed, as will healer. 1 use. > > Night Ability: Serve Wine > > Night Ability: Party
> [color=blue]**Steward (Blue Dragon Offensive)**[/color] > > Passive: Persistent - Occupy and Redirect immune. > > Day Ability: Confound - Disable the targets day Ability’s for the rest of the day. They are not notified until they try to use a day Ability. It still consumes a use of the ability they were trying to use. 3 uses. > > Night Ability: Lead - Redirect your first target to your second. You cannot make your target visit you or themselves. Unlimited uses.
> [color=purple]**Retainer (Unseen Offensive)**[/color] > > Passive: Persistent - Occupy and Redirect immune. > > Day Ability: Confound - Disable the targets day Ability’s for the rest of the day. They are not notified until they try to use a day Ability. It still consumes a use of the ability they were trying to use. 3 uses. > > Night Ability: Lead - Redirect your first target to your second. You cannot make your target visit you or themselves. Unlimited uses.
> **[color=red]Invoker (Cult Offensive)[/color]** > > Passive: Fanatic - Occupy and Redirect immune > > Day ability 1: Bewilder: The next day ability target player uses will fail. 1 use. > > Day ability 2: Empower: Your night ability’s will bypass occupy immunity tonight. 1 use. > > Night ability 1: Chains of Corax: Occupy target player. 3 uses. > > Night ability 2: Strings of Mithras: Redirect target player. You are immune to attacks you redirect. 2 uses.

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I’m personally not convinced that Butler is weak. You can already stop a kill even if you aren’t sure you did, not to mention blocking other members of the Cult/Unseen/Reaper.

And the power to kill the King is huge. It might be worth more if always worked, though.

NuclearBurrito:

Good luck doing that with the number of occ immunes, the existence of jails, heals and other kill stoppers and the fact that you don’t know which class killed any given player.

Well, you’d still be aware of prevention. And if you aren’t sure, you can occupy them again.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

As Butler, you can still look for patterns in the attacks and who you occupy, for one.

Good luck doing that with the number of occ immunes, the existence of jails, heals and other kill stoppers and the fact that you don’t know which class killed any given player.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

With Drunk you’re still gonna try and find killers.

Killer. Not plural. Without the check you only can find the Assassin/CL except in reaper games. And in reaper games you might just die anyway if he empowers.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

The ability to stop all attacks and conversions to yourself is well worth giving up the more blatant investigation. Not to mention the power to kill the King.

What!?

He currently has both and is STILL weak. Its not like we are adding those INSTEAD of notifications.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Prince doesn’t really fit into any category tbh. The only thing Imprison doesn’t function as is Investigation.

With Drunk you’re still gonna try and find killers.

As Butler, you can still look for patterns in the attacks and who you occupy, for one. And in addition you have Party to protect yourself.

The ability to stop all attacks and conversions to yourself is well worth giving up the more blatant investigation. Not to mention the power to kill the King.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
My point exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Well he doesn’t only protecc, he attacc, and he also blocc too

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Just like how prince isn’t meant to protect. The secondary uses of an ability is still valid. Since it encourages interesting play (AKA: Not sitting there doing nothing) it is good that it is there.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Investigation is part of the description of debauch. That makes sense.

Butler/Drunk stop actions, and aren’t made to investigate.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

Butler/Drunk detecting immunity is BS.

No. Its just not. It really just isn’t. Stop saying it is you nerd.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Butler/Drunk detecting immunity is BS.

I feel Party and Nightshade win bridge the gap between Drunk and Butler.

If it really needs a buff to account for it, we could give it one.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Part of them are. And they are getting close.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
I thought the whole point of the past three balance changes was to buff up the Butler to make his usefulness on par with the Drunk’s which is probably somewhat good at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
orangeandblack5:

Surprised that there are no Drunk/Butler changes. That seems weird.

Drunk is in a good spot right now.

Butler however… not so much. I haven’t though of what to do and most people seem to be calling for a major nerf to his feedback which doesn’t really help.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Interesting.

Steward is a more foolproof Transporter-like, which is both good and bad. I’m not opposed, but I wouldn’t beg for it to be added either.

Surprised that there are no Drunk/Butler changes. That seems weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I’m adding Hunter as unique on the main thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: MaximusPrime
item.description:
You’re just going to rip hunter and half and put him in games so possessor and sorcerer can have an easier time? Really? I disagree with all of the hunter changes. He is barely a “hunter” if you reduce bear usages and his uniqueness.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
NightX:

Or you can save your bears. It risks death night one, but you can still do fine. The odds of being attacked are really low.

If you only start bearings n3 you can last to n5 or n8.

Even now, it is better to save bears.

Hunter is great as is imo. I always save bears if I’m not trying to bait. Hunter is a gambling role in certain ways - it’s great to have bears later on.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
It’s okay now.

But the claim space should be a priority, even if we have to tweak Hunter to do so.

I feel like it could work with 2 bears.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Okay true, but on the topic of Hunters, I just feel that they wield too much power when more than one, but is a perfectly balanced class as it is right now, which is why I felt that Hunters should remain as the current class.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Hunter to King:

Defense: Bear and Guards.

Offense: Wolf and Order Execution

Their abilities serve the same purpose.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Well there’s different leaders. King is a constantly open leader.

Hunters are offensive leaders, taking on the role of leader during the day,

while Princes, MM, CL, etc. are secretive leaders, having the actual influence and power of their faction.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Just saying, usual King or Prince is leader, not Hunter, since he can be converted.

I don’t think Hunter even should be a leader, even if bears suggest it is their purpose.

I suppose it could stay unique, but it would really help the claim space if it wasn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The issue isn’t with the hunter but with the assassin’s fear of a hunter being the leader.

Read full topic

item.title: Offensive Reworks
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Or you can save your bears. It risks death night one, but you can still do fine. The odds of being attacked are really low.

If you only start bearings n3 you can last to n5 or n8.

Even now, it is better to save bears.

Read full topic
